verbs.description: uncallow (third-person singular simple present uncallows, present participle uncallowing, simple past and past participle uncallowed)

entries.meaning: (UK, regional, obsolete) To remove the upper stratum of earth in order to reach the bed of gravel, chalk, or other substance beneath.
examples: Owners to uncallow and take off the Soil, Mould, Dirt, or Compost  [â€¦]
